titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Tibor Eckhardt papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-15T11:21-0700

change.item: Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Tibor Eckhardt Papers)//EN" "eckhardt.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, notes, memoranda, clippings and other printed matter relating to twentieth-century Hungarian politics, anti-communist movements in the United States, and Hungarian émigré politics.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual or digital material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tibor Eckhardt papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1980.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Doctor of Law, Peter Pazmany University of Sciences, Budapest, Hungary
Doctor of Law, University of Berlin, Germany

chronitem.event: Served in the Royal Hungarian Ministry of Interior
Attached to the General Staff of the Austro-Hungarian Army and the Administration of Transylvania
Organized active resistance with police force against the communist regime of Bela Kun in Hungary
Chief of Press Section, Hungarian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, later in the Prime Minister's Office
Elected to the Hungarian Parliament as member of the Government Party
Went into opposition against the conservative government
Visited the United States upon the invitation of President Butler of Columbia University; lectured at American universities under the auspices of the Carnegie Endowment
Founded the Hungarian Small Holders' Party and became its leader
Chief Delegate of Hungary to the League of Nations, Geneva
Leader of the democratic opposition in Hungary
Visited the United States for the second time, received by President Roosevelt, who invited him to come to the United States in case Hungary was overrun by the Nazis
Collaborated with the U.S. State Department
Participated in organizing the Hungarian National Council and accepted membership in its Executive Committee

eventgrp.event: Resigned from the Executive Committee of the Hungarian National Council
Participated in organizing the Assembly of Captive European Nations and became Chairman of its Hungarian delegation

chronitem.event: Launched the organization "First Aid for Hungary," with Herbert Hoover as Honorary Chairman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, notes, memoranda, clippings and other printed matter relating to twentieth-century Hungarian politics, anti-communist movements in the United States, and Hungarian émigré politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical data and personal documents, arranged alphabetically by subject.
